intro: Jacobinia ovata, commonly known as the oval-leaf Jacobinia, is a small evergreen shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its glossy, ovate-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Jacobinia ovata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
